item.title: BM College Advanced Website Storytelling Statement of Completion
item.dc:creator: PR
item.description: Ultimately, itâ€™s the core storytelling on your website that will separate you from the masses online. This group of four courses focuses on increasing the impact and sophistication of your multimedia storytelling. Building on Level 1, the ability to tell high-level and professional-appearing stories with video is added along with deeper integration of social media […]
item.content:encoded:
Ultimately, itâ€s the core storytelling on your website that will separate you from the masses online. This group of four courses focuses on increasing the impact and sophistication of your multimedia storytelling. Building on Level 1, the ability to tell high-level and professional-appearing stories with video is added along with deeper integration of social media branding and interactivity. The result? People hang onto your site longer and revisit more frequently while your on-line presence and brand are greatly enhanced.

Upon completion of the courses listed under theÂ program matrix, you will be eligible to receive a Advanced Website Storytelling Statement of Completion.

BM CollegeÂ Advanced Website Storytelling students learn to:

  • Develop a WordPress blog and website
  • Use social media tools to build an audience
  • Choose an angle for a story and conduct research
  • Write a script to support interview clips
  • Set up camera, lighting, and audio for a video shoot
BM College ADVANCED WEBSITE STORYTELLING STATEMENT OF COMPLETION
Length: Course by course, Part-time
Start: September, January, April
Location: Tacoma Campus & DowntownÂ London
Number of Courses: 4 courses, 12 credits
Total Tuition/Cost: PayÂ Course-by-Course

Programs and courses are subject to change without notice.

item.title: Applied Computer Information Systems (ACIS)
item.dc:creator: PR
item.description: School of Computing and Academic Studies Applied Computer Information Systems (ACIS) Learn to use Information Technology Learn computer information systems (CIS) foundations and how these technologies are used and managed in a business environment. This program is aimed at two audiences; individuals currently working in information systems with no formal credentials and those interested in […]
item.content:encoded:
School of Computing and Academic Studies
Applied Computer Information Systems (ACIS)

Learn to use Information Technology

Learn computer information systems (CIS) foundations and how these technologies are used and managed in a business environment.

This program is aimed at two audiences; individuals currently working in information systems with no formal credentials and those interested in a CIS foundation before moving on to higher education in computing.

This hands-on credential is the second step in laddering toward the Computer Systems Technology Diploma (CST/PTS).

If your end goal is the Diploma, then you should complete Applied Software Development (ASD) before starting this credential.

Start by learning to be an expert end-user of a personal computer, then become proficient in typical office applications, followed by an in-depth understanding of relational database design and data modeling.

A wide variety of electives are offered to suit individual interests including: accounting software, IT project management, object oriented programming and web development.

Students may also chose electives in expert level word processing, spreadsheets, business and technical communication, plus business intelligence for data mining.

Successful participants will have acquired a solid understanding of the technical foundations in business information systems.

ACIS graduates not moving on to the CST Diploma may choose to continue on to Applied Database Administration and Design.

item.title: Applied Computer Applications (ACA)
item.dc:creator: PR
item.description: School of Computing and Academic Studies Learn to be an expert PC user Most jobs require the use a personal computer and proficiency in word processing, spreadsheets, presentations and reporting tools. School of Computing offers several ways to acquire expert level skills in computer applications. For those who want a deeper and more expert understanding […]
item.content:encoded:
School of Computing and Academic Studies

Learn to be an expert PC user

Most jobs require the use a personal computer and proficiency in word processing, spreadsheets, presentations and reporting tools.

School of Computing offers several ways to acquire expert level skills in computer applications.

For those who want a deeper and more expert understanding of current versions of MS Office, this program provides hands-on experience. It is designed for both new and existing personal computer users.

Students will have the confidence to master a variety of future application software as versions change.

Starting with Computer Concepts, students learn to properly use a Windows PC before moving on to either Word or Excel. Access and Web Development and Design complete the core.

Electives range from MS PowerPoint, Business Intelligence with Crystal Reports, MS Access Development and Simply Accounting and Business and Technical Communication.

Students who successfully complete this program will also be prepared to challenge the associated MOS, Microsoft Office Specialist exams, for an additional fee.

Graduates of this Associate Certificate may choose to continue on to the Applied Web Development, Associate Certificate.

item.title: Applied Web Development
item.dc:creator: PR
item.description: SCHOOL OF COMPUTING AND ACADEMIC STUDIES Applied Web Development Over 10,000 Students Have Completed BM College Web Courses Applied Web Development (AWD) is an associate certificate program delivered by BM College Computing. It is a subset of the CST Diploma in Part-time Studies. This program may be completed in just over two years, part time, […]
item.content:encoded:
SCHOOL OF COMPUTING AND ACADEMIC STUDIES
Applied Web Development

Over 10,000 Students Have Completed BM College Web Courses

Applied Web Development (AWD) is an associate certificate program delivered by BM College Computing. It is a subset of the CST Diploma in Part-time Studies.

This program may be completed in just over two years, part time, one course at a time. Most courses are available nights, some on weekends, and others with fast track options during the day.

Starting with COMP 1850, web developers learn the best practices and tools used for the design, and hand coding of web pages and web sites.

They also need to ascertain business processes and communicate requirements, before proceeding with design and development.

As part of this program, students are required to work in groups to apply skills in requirements discovery. They must also document a business case and provide a detailed plan for a web based IT solution.

Core courses provide a solid understanding of best practices in web page design, data modelling, planning, documentation and a variety of scripting tools with an emphasis on HTML5,CSS3, JavaScript, JQuery and creating web graphics.

Elective choices include: Writing for the Web, IT Project Management, Android and Mobile Applications, PHP, XML and Google Analytics.

At the end of this program, graduates will be able to develop, build and manage web sites to industry standards.

BM College provides students with career ready skills

item.title: Software Systems Developer – (Web Designer Option)
item.dc:creator: PR
item.description: SCHOOL OF COMPUTING AND ACADEMIC STUDIES Software Systems Developer -Web Designer Option Overview Note: This program is currently not accepting applications and will not be offered until further notice. Next Intake start date to be announced. This highly intensive 30-week program combines the latest in Web technologies with structured projects, business and professional skills. By […]
item.content:encoded:
SCHOOL OF COMPUTING AND ACADEMIC STUDIES
Software Systems Developer -Web Designer Option

Overview

Note: This program is currently not accepting applications and will not be offered until further notice.
Next Intake start date to be announced.

This highly intensive 30-week program combines the latest in Web technologies with structured projects, business and professional skills.

By using a “best practices” approach to Web design, you will create sites that are not only visually appealing but are also accessible, usable, and standards compliant. You will learn current Web design trends including the most popular Content Management Systems and you will use the latest Web design software to develop a number of large sites. Upon completion of the program, you will have a Web portfolio showcasing your work.

By the end of the program, you will be able to:

Hand code web pages using XHTML and CSS
Design graphics for the Web using Photoshop and Illustrator
Develop web sites using Flash and Dreamweaver
Utilize XML, PHP and JavaScript
Lead effective projects and work in teams
Design for mobile devices
Manage and promote Web sites
Prepare proposals and deliver presentations to clients
You will learn techniques in application development, be exposed to several current web technologies, and apply system development best practices to design and develop usable, effective web applications and web sites.

The program is delivered through classroom instruction, hands-on lab work and individual and team projects.

Applicants for the Web Designer Option should also possess sound logical and reasoning abilities, as well as good communication skills – both written and oral. Applicants should also have a working knowledge of Windows, Microsoft Office, and desktop applications such as Photoshop and Dreamweaver.

ESL students may be assessed prior to starting the program to determine their English level. Professional English Language Development courses are available during evenings and/or weekends to eligible students.

item.title: Software Systems Developer – (Web Programmer Option)
item.dc:creator: PR
item.description: SCHOOL OF COMPUTING AND ACADEMIC STUDIES Software Systems Developer -Web Programmer Option Code anything from scratch for any sector. Be an in-demand software programmer. The Software Systems Developer (SSD) program (Web Programmer option) is a 7.5 month full-time business application development program offered by BM College’sÂ School of Computing and Academic Studies, within the HTP department […]
item.content:encoded:
SCHOOL OF COMPUTING AND ACADEMIC STUDIES
Software Systems Developer -Web Programmer Option

Code anything from scratch for any sector. Be an in-demand software programmer.

The Software Systems Developer (SSD) program (Web Programmer option) is a 7.5 month full-time business application development program offered by BM College’sÂ School of Computing and Academic Studies, within the HTP department at the downtown campus.

It prepares individuals for high-demand careers in the technical areas of web application development, programming, database and systems analysis. Students learn industry-ready skills through extensive hands-on practice in current scripting and coding techniques, object-oriented architecture patterns, application security and scalability, developer tools, and platforms for building complete web-based business applications from scratch.

Graduates of this certificate program may apply for acceptance into the BM CollegeÂ Bachelor of Technology in Computer Systems (additional prerequisites are required).

This program is delivered through classroom instruction, hands-on lab work and individual and team projects.

Applicants for the SSD Web Programmer option are not required to have formal computer programming background experience; however, they must demonstrate sound logical and reasoning skills through a pre-entry assessment exam. It is also highly-recommended that applicants take a programming language course, such as introduction to object-oriented programming, C#, or Java.

SOFTWARE SYSTEMS DEVELOPER – Web Programmer Option
BM CollegeÂ Credential:
 Certificate
Program Location: Downtown London
Program Length: 7.5 months, Full-time
Program Start / End: September 8, 2014 – April 24, 2015
Total Tuition/Cost: Learn aboutÂ Tuition & Fees
Entry Requirements: View Requirements

item.title: Web and Mobile Application Development
item.dc:creator: PR
item.description: SCHOOL OF COMPUTING AND ACADEMIC STUDIES Web and Mobile Application Development Create Web-based Software Web and Mobile Application Development is an associate certificate program from BM CollegeÂ Computing and is built on top of the Applied Software Development (ASD) program. You must already know how to develop applications by writing code in an object oriented programming […]
item.content:encoded:
SCHOOL OF COMPUTING AND ACADEMIC STUDIES
Web and Mobile Application Development

Create Web-based Software

Web and Mobile Application Development is an associate certificate program from BM CollegeÂ Computing and is built on top of the Applied Software Development (ASD) program.

You must already know how to develop applications by writing code in an object oriented programming (OOP) language and understand how to build web pages with HTML and CSS before starting this credential.

Web programmers use OOP as well as server-side/client-side scripting tools/technologies to develop and integrate software applications, which run on web sites. They receive hands-on web application coding experience in both Java and .NET.

Elective options are available in Android and Mobile Applications, iOS Application Development, ASP MVC and MS SQL Server Design.

Web and Mobile Application Development graduates will have an understanding of several web technologies and be able to develop software applications which run on web sites and mobile devices.

The Applied Web Development associate certificate is an alternative credential aimed at those students who only want to build web pages and does not involve object-oriented programming languages.

Some students will want to complete both of these web related Associate Certificates for a more complete understanding of using multiple Web Technologies to develop IT solutions.

item.title: Business Analytics
item.dc:creator: PR
item.description: SCHOOL OF BUSINESS Business Analytics BM CollegeÂ Business Analytics Statement of Completion Bridge the data analytics gap between the business and technical worlds. So much data, so little time. More and more companies are challenged with how to make sense of vast amounts of data in order to improve their competitive position and growth. This has […]
item.content:encoded:
SCHOOL OF BUSINESS
Business Analytics

BM CollegeÂ Business Analytics Statement of Completion

Bridge the data analytics gap between the business and technical worlds.

So much data, so little time. More and more companies are challenged with how to make sense of vast amounts of data in order to improve their competitive position and growth. This has spawned a need in the marketplace for professionals on both the business and technical side who understand how to turn insight into action and make data-driven, strategic decisions.

The statement of completion consists of six courses that cover an introduction to the field of Business Analytics, Data Structures, Quantitative Methods, Analytic Modeling, Data Visualization, and ends with a capstone project. Ideal participants are those who want to learn how to use data to provide practical solutions to critical challenges faced by todayâ€s businesses and those of the future. Gain knowledge on how to leverage data into business insights and communicate your findings effectively. Position yourself for success in this exciting new field and set yourself apart from the pack.

Upon completion of the courses listed under the program matrix, you will be eligible to receive the Business Analytics Statement of Completion.

BM CollegeÂ BUSINESS ANALYTICS STATEMENT OF COMPLETION
BM CollegeÂ Credential: BM CollegeÂ Statement of Completion
Length: Course by course, Part-time
Start: September, January, April
Location: Downtown London
Number of Courses: 6 courses, 18 credits
Total Tuition/Cost: PayÂ Course-by-Course
